title: Bad Highways
citation: <q>Motor Highways Poor in the National Parks: Only $3,000,000 Spent for Highways in Federal Parks in Fifty Years -- Senator Phipps Urges Better Service for Increasing Number of Visitors.</q> New York Times 11 Mar. 1923: 6. ProQuest Historical Newspapers. Web. 18 Dec. 2011.
caption: This article brought attention to the lack of adequate transportation to Yellowstone National Park in 1923 (<q>Motor Highways</q>). After it was published, Wyoming issued a bond of $3,000,000 for the construction of a highway to Yellowstone National Park to improve tourism (Bement).

title: Cross Country Travel
citation: Bond, Newton C. <q>See United States by Motor Pleasure in Continental Tour.</q> New York Times 7 Jan. 1923: 14. ProQuest Historical Newspapers. Web. 18 Dec. 2011.
caption: This story's coverage of a family making the long trip to Yellowstone without incident made the journey feel more accessible to families on the East Coast. It decreased the daunting feeling that a cross country adventure had once inspired (Bond).

title: Great Northwest
citation: America's Great Northwest. Advertisement. New York Times 18 Jan. 1920: BR24. ProQuest Historical Newspapers - Graphical. Web. 29 Nov. 2011.
caption: Travel guides spread knowledge of places like Yellowstone, promoting tourism.  Books offered another form of media that increased the number of tourists to Yellowstone National Park (<q>America's Great Northwest</q>)

title: Pleasure Tours
citation: Raymond & Whitcomb. Pleasure Tours. Advertisement. New York Times 11 Mar. 1900: 26. ProQuest Historical Newspapers - Graphical. Web. 29 Nov. 2011.
caption: Located in Union Square, the Raymond & Whitcomb company offered tours around the world, and used Yellowstone National Park as a selling point for their tours out West (<q>Raymond & Whitcomb, Pleasure Tours</q>).

title: Traveller's Guide
citation: Raymond & Whitcomb. Railroads. Advertisement. New York Times 25 Feb. 1900: 26. ProQuest Historical Newspapers - Graphical. Web. 29 Nov. 2011.
caption: Using detailed descriptions of the park, Raymond & Whitcomb increased tourism, and thus facilitated the growth of Yellowstone (<q>Raymond & Whitcomb, Pleasure Tours; Raymond & Whitcomb, Railroads</q>)

title: Union Pacific
citation: Union Pacific Railroad. Railroad. Advertisement. New York Times 2 Jan. 1946: 13. ProQuest Historical Newspapers - Graphical. Web. 30 Nov. 2011.
caption: <q>Be specific, say Union Pacific!</q> This catch phrase was used by the Union Pacific Railroad to promote tourists to use their rail line. By placing ads in the newspaper, railroads increased awareness of Yellowstone to the general public (<q>Union Pacific Railroad</q>).

title: Visitors to NPs
citation: <q>Million Visitors to National Parks: Nearly 350,000 Persons a Month Took Advantage of
caption: National Playgrounds during the Season.</q> New York Times 4 Mar. 1923: REA11. ProQuest Historical Newspapers. Web. 18 Dec. 2011.
